definition: ingrained habits are hard to overcome (idiom); bad old practices die hard

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing

sentences.english: That financial risks diehard of many private enterprises is the main cause toward their dooms.
sentences.chinese: 财务隐患的积重难返是很多民营企业走向末路的主因。

sentences.english: The reform of taxi industry, the front faces the dilemma of bad old practices die hard.
sentences.chinese: 出租车行业的改革，正面临积重难返的困境。

sentences.english: These political difficulties are piled on top of cultural difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 这些政治刁难是由文化困境积重难返造成的。

sentences.english: The world economy is probably knackered, whatever we might do now.
sentences.chinese: 无论我们现在作何努力，世界经济都很可能积重难返。

definition: old habits are hard to change (idiom)
large tail obstructs action (idiom); bottom heavy/fig. rendered ineffective by subordinates
lit. the disease has attacked the vitals (idiom); fig. beyond cure/the situation is hopeless
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster/to cherish a viper in one's bosom
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
